description.narrative: Dune de Miel produces and markets natural food products made of ingredients generally known for their nutritional properties. The company currently offers around ten.natural products without additives based on cocoa, coffee, ginger, baobab, petit cola, bissap, and with honey.as the only preservative. Through its grant with USADF, Dune de Miels aims to strengthen its capacity for expansion through: 1) the certification of its products to meet international standards; 2) the development of its branding and marketing approach; and 3) an increase in its production capacity.

description.narrative: ORIMO Plus is a mobile application that provides career guidance to high school students to enhance their capacity to find their most suitable field of interest out of high school. The application enables students to meet with teachers online and in person, while giving students access to discounted digital textbooks. Through the mobile application, students are able to track and record their progress in various school subjects, upon which the application will provide students with personalized feedback and career path suggestions.

title.narrative: Academy for Women Entrepreneurs (AWE) - Baaba Enterprise

description.narrative: Baaba is an herbal tea company that provides kinkeliba, a natural and organic plant indigenous to Africa, in bulk and in tea bags. Kinkeliba is seen as having beneficial health properties, and is appreciated by Ivorian populations coping with diabetes, hypertension, insomnia, obesity, and stress. Kinkeliba is often consumed from an unpacked state, which makes it unsanitary and slower to prepare. Baaba will provide sanitary, packaged and ready-to-use kinkeliba tea bags making the product safer and easier to consume. Additionally, Baaba will effectively market the kinkeliba tea to make it more visible and attractive to a wider market.

description.narrative: Etoduma SARL is an agri-food company that processes locally grown plantains and sweet potatoes into chips. The project aims to improve the productivity and product quality of Etodumas products to better meet the demands of the Ivorian market for plantain and sweet potato chips. USADF funds will cover the following expenses: 1) slicing and peeling equipment; 2) draining equipment;.3) bagging machine; 4) irrigation equipment; 5) working capital for the purchase of plantains and sweet.potatoes; 6) packaging for Chips; 7) working capital for plantain input; 8) training on USADF rules and.regulations; 9) training in best production practices; 10) local and international food quality certification;.11) accounting staff; 12) training of producers on good agricultural practices; 13) marketing and sales.assistance; and 14) IT equipment.
